title: Pastel de Nata com Coco
ingredients: puff pastry, coconut milk, egg yolks, sugar,flour, cinnamon stick, lemon
recipe: Preheat the oven to 220°C. In a pot, mix the coconut milk, sugar, flour, cinnamon stick and lemon peel. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat, let it cool and then add the egg yolks. Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into small circles. Place them in muffin tins, and then add the coconut cream mixture. Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool before serving.

title: Vegan Baba de Camelo
ingredients: sweetened condensed coconut milk, aquafaba, coconut sugar, water
recipe: In a bowl, mix the sweetened condensed coconut milk with the aquafaba. In another bowl, beat the aquafaba until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the coconut sugar while beating. Fold the aquafaba into the condensed coconut milk mixture. Pour the mixture into a cake pan and cover with foil. Place the pan in a larger pan and add water to the larger pan, until it reaches halfway up the sides of the smaller pan. Bake in the oven at 180°C for about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let it cool. Serve chilled.

title: Baba de Camelo
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, sugar, water
recipe: In a bowl, mix the condensed milk with the egg yolks. In another bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the sugar while beating. Fold the egg whites into the condensed milk mixture. Pour the mixture into a cake pan and cover with foil. Place the pan in a larger pan and add water to the larger pan, until it reaches halfway up the sides of the smaller pan. Bake in the oven at 180°C for about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let it cool. Serve chilled.

title: Baba de Camelo Version
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, cornstarch
notes: This recipe can be garnished with shaved chocolate or coconut flakes.
recipe: Mix all the ingredients in a blender until smooth. Pour the mixture into a pot and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Remove from heat and pour into a serving dish. Chill in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.

title: Baba de Camelo Version
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, lemon zest
notes: This recipe is perfect for those who enjoy a tangy flavor in their desserts.
recipe: Whisk together the condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, and lemon zest in a pot. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Pour the mixture into a serving dish and chill in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.

title: Baba de Camelo Version
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, coconut flakes
notes: This recipe is perfect for those who love coconut flavor in their desserts.
recipe: Combine the condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, and coconut flakes in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a pot and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Pour the mixture into a serving dish and chill in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.

title: Aletria with Almonds
ingredients: aletria, almond milk, sugar, cinnamon stick,toasted almonds, lemon
recipe: Cook the aletria in boiling water for about 5 minutes, then drain and rinse it with cold water. In a pot, heat the almond milk with the cinnamon stick, lemon peel and sugar. Once it starts boiling, add the aletria and let it cook until it thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove the cinnamon stick and lemon peel, and transfer the aletria to a serving dish. Sprinkle with toasted almonds before serving.

title: Aletria with Coconut Milk
ingredients: aletria, coconut milk, sugar, cinnamon stick, vanilla pod, coconut
recipe: Cook the aletria in boiling water for about 5 minutes, then drain and rinse it with cold water. In a pot, heat the coconut milk with the cinnamon stick, vanilla pod and sugar. Once it starts boiling, add the aletria and let it cook until it thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove the cinnamon stick and vanilla pod, and transfer the aletria to a serving dish. Sprinkle with shredded coconut before serving.

title: Aletria with Orange
ingredients: aletria, milk, sugar, cinnamon stick, orange, butter
recipe: Cook the aletria in boiling water for about 5 minutes, then drain and rinse it with cold water. In a pot, heat the milk with the cinnamon stick, orange zest and sugar. Once it starts boiling, add the aletria and let it cook until it thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove the cinnamon stick and orange zest, and stir in the butter until it melts. Transfer the aletria to a serving dish and let it cool. Cut the orange into small pieces and sprinkle over the top before serving.

title: Aletria with Pumpkin
ingredients: aletria, pumpkin, milk, sugar, cinnamon stick, lemon
recipe: Peel and chop the pumpkin into small pieces. Cook it in boiling water for about 10 minutes, then drain and mash it. In a pot, heat the milk with the cinnamon stick, lemon peel and sugar. Once it starts boiling, add the aletria and let it cook until it thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove the cinnamon stick and lemon peel, and stir in the mashed pumpkin. Transfer the aletria to a serving dish and let it cool.

title: Aletria with Chocolate
ingredients: aletria, milk, sugar, cinnamon stick, dark chocolate, chocolate
recipe: Cook the aletria in boiling water for about 5 minutes, then drain and rinse it with cold water. In a pot, heat the milk with the cinnamon stick and sugar. Once it starts boiling, add the aletria and let it cook until it thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove the cinnamon stick and stir in the dark chocolate until it melts. Transfer the aletria to a serving dish and sprinkle with chocolate chips before serving.

title: Bolinhos de Bacalhau
ingredients: cod, 1kg of potatoes, eggs, onion, garlic, parsley, salt, black pepper, olive oil
recipe: Boil the cod and potatoes separately until they are soft. Drain and mash them together. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, beaten eggs, parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Shape the mixture into small balls and fry them in hot olive oil until golden brown.

title: Bolinhos de Bacalhau
ingredients: cod, potatoes, egg, onion, garlic, breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper, olive oil
recipe: Boil the cod and potatoes together until they are soft. Drain and mash them together. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, beaten egg, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Shape the mixture into small balls and fry them in hot olive oil until golden brown.

title: Bolinhos de Bacalhau
ingredients: cod, potatoes, eggs, onion, garlic, flour, salt, black pepper, olive oil
recipe: Boil the cod and potatoes together until they are soft. Drain and mash them together. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, beaten eggs, flour, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Shape the mixture into small balls and fry them in hot olive oil until golden brown.

title: Bolinhos de Bacalhau
ingredients: cod, potatoes, eggs, onion, garlic, cornmeal, salt, black pepper, olive oil
recipe: Boil the cod and potatoes together until they are soft. Drain and mash them together. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, beaten eggs, cornmeal, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Shape the mixture into small balls and fry them in hot olive oil until golden brown.

title: Bolinhos de Bacalhau
ingredients: cod, potatoes, eggs, onion, garlic, semolina, salt, black pepper, olive oil
recipe: Boil the cod and potatoes together until they are soft. Drain and mash them together. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, beaten eggs, semolina, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Shape the mixture into small balls and fry them in hot olive oil until golden brown.

title: Bacalhau com Natas
ingredients: salt cod, onion, garlic, leaves, potatoes, milk, cream, butter, olive oil, salt, pepper, nutmeg, parsley
recipe: Soak the salt cod in cold water for 2hours, changing the water 3 to times. Boil the cod for 5 minutes and remove any skin and bones. Peel and cut the potatoes into thin slices. In a pan, sauté the chopped onion and garlic in olive oil and butter. Add the bay leaves and milk, and let it boil for 2-3 minutes. Add the potatoes and let it cook until they are soft. Add the cod, cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg, and mix well. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake for 20-30 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley.

title: Bacalhau com Natas
ingredients: salt cod, onion, garlic, leaves, potatoes, milk, cream, olive oil, butter, salt, pepper, nutmeg, parsley
recipe: Soak the salt cod in cold water for 2hours, changing the water 3 to times. Boil the cod for 5 minutes and remove any skin and bones. Peel and cut the potatoes into small cubes. In a pan, sauté the chopped onion and garlic in olive oil and butter. Add the bay leaves and milk, and let it boil for 2-3 minutes. Add the potatoes and let it cook until they are soft. Add the cod, cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg, and mix well. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake for 20-30 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley.

title: Bacalhau com Natas
ingredients: salt cod, onion, garlic, leaves, potatoes, milk, cheese, eggs, olive oil, salt, pepper, nutmeg, parsley
recipe: Soak the salt cod in cold water for 2hours, changing the water 3 to times. Boil the cod for 5 minutes and remove any skin and bones. Peel and cut the potatoes into thin slices. In a pan, sauté the chopped onion and garlic in olive oil. Add the bay leaves and milk, and let it boil for 2-3 minutes. Add the potatoes and let it cook until they are soft. Add the cod, grated cheese, eggs, salt, pepper, and nutmeg, and mix well. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake for 20-30 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley.

title: Francesinha
ingredients: bread, steak, linguiça , sausage, ham, cheese, egg, fries, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, beer
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the paprika, tomato sauce and beer, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, cook the beef steak, sausages and ham. Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the steak, followed by the ham and sausages. Add the cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. In the same pan used to cook the meat, fry an egg. Put the egg on top of the sandwich and cover it with the tomato sauce. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce, to thicken it. Serve with French fries.

title: Francesinha with Portobello Mushrooms
ingredients: bread, steak,portobello mushrooms, sausage, ham, cheese, egg, fries, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, beer
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the paprika, tomato sauce and beer, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, cook the beef steak and portobello mushrooms, and sausages and ham in a separate pan. Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the steak and portobello mushrooms, followed by the ham and sausages. Add the cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. In the same pan used to cook the meat, fry an egg. Put the egg on top of the sandwich and cover it with the tomato sauce. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce, to thicken it. Serve with French fries.

title: Francesinha without Ham
ingredients: bread, steak, linguiça, sausage, cheese, egg, fries, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, beer
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the paprika, tomato sauce and beer, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, cook the beef steak, sausages in a separate pan. Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the steak, followed by the sausages. Add the cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. In the same pan used to cook the meat, fry an egg. Put the egg on top of the sandwich and cover it with the tomato sauce. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce, to thicken it. Serve with French fries.

title: Vegan Francesinha
ingredients: bread, seitan, large portobello mushroom, red bell pepper, vegan cheese, flax egg, fries, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, beer
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the paprika, tomato sauce and beer, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, grill the seitan, portobello mushroom, and red bell pepper. Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the grilled seitan, mushroom, and red pepper. Add the vegan cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. In the same pan used to grill the vegetables, make a flax egg and fry it. Put the egg on top of the sandwich and cover it with the tomato sauce. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce, to thicken it. Serve with French fries.

title: Francesinha seafood
ingredients: bread, shrimp, squid, mussels, cheese, egg, fries, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, white wine
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the paprika, tomato sauce, and white wine, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, cook the seafood (shrimp, squid, and mussels). Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the seafood. Add the cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. In the same pan used to cook the seafood, fry an egg. Put the egg on top of the sandwich and cover it with the tomato sauce. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce to thicken it. Serve with French fries.

title: Chicken-Free Francesinha
ingredients: whole wheat bread, portobello mushroom cap, vegan sausage, vegan cheese,avocado, peppers, onions, zucchini, olive oil, garlic, leaves, paprika, cornstarch, tomato sauce, beer
recipe: In a pan, sauté the garlic with olive oil and bay leaves. Add the smoked paprika, tomato sauce and beer, and let it cook for about 15 minutes. In another pan, cook the portobello mushroom cap, vegan sausage, mixed vegetables and avocado. Place the slices of bread on a dish, and then add the portobello mushroom cap, followed by the vegan sausage, mixed vegetables and avocado. Add the vegan cheese on top, and put the dish in the oven until the cheese melts. Mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water and add it to the tomato sauce, to thicken it. Pour the tomato sauce over the sandwich. Serve with a side salad.

title: Pastel de Nata com Doce de Leite
ingredients: puff pastry, milk, egg yolks, sugar,flour, cinnamon stick, lemon , dulce de leche
recipe: Preheat the oven to 220°C. In a pot, mix the milk, sugar, flour, cinnamon stick and lemon peel. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat, let it cool and then add the egg yolks. Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into small circles. Place them in muffin tins, and then add the cream mixture. Add a teaspoon of dulce de leche on top of each one. Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool before serving.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto
ingredients: tripe, pig's ear, pig's foot, pig's tail, chorizo, morcela, onion, garlic, bay leaf, olive oil, butter, water, salt and pepper.
recipe: Clean the tripe and soak it in cold water for 12 hours. Cut the pig's ear, foot, and tail into pieces. In a pressure cooker, cook the tripe, pig's ear, foot, tail, chorizo, and morcela in water for about 45 minutes. In a separate pan, sauté the chopped onion, garlic, and bay leaf with olive oil and butter until the onion is translucent. Add this mixture to the pressure cooker with the meat, and cook for another 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto
ingredients: tripe, pig's ear, pig's foot, pig's tail, chorizo, morcela, onion, garlic, bay leaf, olive oil, butter, beef broth, salt and pepper.
recipe: Clean the tripe and soak it in cold water for 12 hours. Cut the pig's ear, foot, and tail into pieces. In a pressure cooker, cook the tripe, pig's ear, foot, tail, chorizo, and morcela in beef broth for about 45 minutes. In a separate pan, sauté the chopped onion, garlic, and bay leaf with olive oil and butter until the onion is translucent. Add this mixture to the pressure cooker with the meat, and cook for another 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto
ingredients: tripe, pig's ear, pig's foot, pig's tail, chorizo, morcela, onions, garlic, bay leaf, olive oil, butter, water, salt and pepper.
recipe: Clean the tripe and soak it in cold water for 12 hours. Cut the pig's ear, foot, and tail into pieces. In a pot, cook the tripe, pig's ear, foot, tail, chorizo, and morcela in water for about 1 hour. In a separate pan, sauté the chopped onions, garlic, and bay leaf with olive oil and butter until the onion is translucent. Add this mixture to the pot with the meat, and cook for another 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto com Feijão Branco
ingredients: tripe, white beans, onion, garlic, carrots, leaves, tomato paste, olive oil, salt, black pepper
recipe: Soak the beans overnight. In a pot, cook the beans in water with 1 bay leaf until tender. Cut the tripe into small pieces and boil in water for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. In another pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf in olive oil. Add the carrots and tomato paste, and cook for a few minutes. Add the tripe and the cooked beans, and cook until the tripe is tender. Season with salt and black pepper.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto com Arroz
ingredients: tripe, rice, onion, garlic, carrots, leaves, olive oil, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the tripe into small pieces and boil in water for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. In another pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf in olive oil. Add the carrots and cook for a few minutes. Add the tripe and enough water to cover it, and cook until the tripe is tender. Season with salt and black pepper. Cook the rice separately, and serve it with the tripe stew.

title: Tripas à Moda do Porto com Batatas
ingredients: tripe, potatoes, onion, garlic, carrots, leaves, olive oil, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the tripe into small pieces and boil in water for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. In another pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf in olive oil. Add the carrots and cook for a few minutes. Add the tripe and enough water to cover it, and cook until the tripe is tender. Season with salt and black pepper. Peel and chop the potatoes, and cook them in a separate pot until tender. Serve the tripe stew with the cooked potatoes.

title: Jardineira Tradicional
ingredients: beef chuck, potatoes, carrots, turnip, onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, beef broth, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the beef into small cubes, and peel and chop the vegetables. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the beef and brown it. Add the vegetables and bay leaf, and cook for a few minutes. Add the beef broth, season with salt and black pepper, and simmer for about an hour, until the beef and vegetables are tender.

title: Bacalhau à Braz com Legumes
ingredients: salt cod, large potatoes, onion, eggs, olive oil, garlic,chopped parsley,sliced olives, carrots, green beans, peas, salt, black pepper
recipe: Soak the salt cod overnight in water, changing the water several times. Boil the cod in a pot of water until it flakes easily. Flake the cod into small pieces and set aside. Peel and julienne the potatoes and fry them in olive oil until golden brown. Remove the potatoes from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, sauté the sliced onions and garlic until they become translucent. Add the flaked cod and the mixed vegetables, and cook for a few minutes. Beat the eggs and add them to the pan, stirring constantly until they are cooked. Add the parsley and olives, season with salt and black pepper, and serve hot.

title: Cozido Portuguesa com Feijão Branco
ingredients: beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo , black pudding sausage, onion, garlic, carrot, turnip, cabbage, white beans, leaves, salt, pepper, water
notes: A hearty ,filling dish, ideal for cold days
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo and black pudding, and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 30 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, turnip and bay leaves, and let it cook for another 30 minutes. Add the white beans and cabbage, and let it cook for another 30 minutes, or until everything is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Cozido Portuguesa com Grão
ingredients: beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo , black pudding sausage, onion, garlic, carrot, turnip, cabbage, chickpeas, leaves, salt, pepper, water
notes: A filling ,nutritious dish, perfect for a cold winter day
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo and black pudding, and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 30 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, turnip and bay leaves, and let it cook for another 30 minutes. Add the chickpeas and cabbage, and let it cook for another 30 minutes, or until everything is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Cozido Portuguesa com Couve
ingredients: beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo , black pudding sausage, onion, garlic, carrot, turnip, cabbage, leaves, salt, pepper, water
notes: A classic ,traditional Portuguese dish, perfect for a family meal
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo and black pudding, and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 30 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, turnip and bay leaves, and let it cook for another 30 minutes. Add the cabbage, and let it cook for another 30 minutes, or until everything is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Cozido Portuguesa com Batata
ingredients: beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo , black pudding sausage, onion, garlic, carrot, turnip, cabbage, potatoes, leaves, salt, pepper, water
notes: A classic ,traditional Portuguese dish, perfect for a family meal
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef ribs, pork belly, chicken, chorizo and black pudding, and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 30 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, turnip and bay leaves, and let it cook for another 30 minutes. Add the potatoes and cabbage, and let it cook for another 30 minutes, or until everything is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Arroz de Cabidela com Coelho
ingredients: rabbit, onions, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, tomato, carolino rice, liter of water, tablespoon of salt,white wine vinegar
recipe: In a pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf with olive oil. Peel and chop the tomato, and add it to the pot. Let it cook until the tomato is soft. Add the rabbit pieces and 1 tablespoon of salt. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 20 minutes on medium heat. Add enough water to cover the rabbit and let it cook until the meat is tender. Remove the rabbit pieces from the pot and set them aside. Add the rice to the pot and stir it. Let it cook for about 15 minutes. Return the rabbit to the pot, add the vinegar and stir. Let it cook for 5 more minutes. Serve hot.

title: Arroz de Cabidela com Galinha Caipira
ingredients: chicken, onions, of garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, tomato, carolino rice, liter of water, tablespoon of salt, tablespoons of red wine vinegar
recipe: In a pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf with olive oil. Peel and chop the tomato, and add it to the pot. Let it cook until the tomato is soft. Add the chicken pieces and 1 tablespoon of salt. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 30 minutes on medium heat. Add enough water to cover the chicken and let it cook until the meat is tender. Remove the chicken pieces from the pot and set them aside. Add the rice to the pot and stir it. Let it cook for about 15 minutes. Return the chicken to the pot, add the vinegar and stir. Let it cook for 5 more minutes. Serve hot.

title: Caldo Verde
ingredients: potatoes, onion, garlic, kale, chorizo, olive oil, salt, water
recipe: Peel and slice the potatoes, onion, and garlic. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until they are golden brown. Add the potatoes and water (enough to cover the potatoes) and cook until the potatoes are soft. Using a blender, blend the potatoes and water until smooth. In a separate pot, cook the kale until it's tender. Slice the chouriço and add it to the pot. Add the blended potato and water mixture to the pot with the kale and chouriço. Bring the mixture to a boil, and then let it simmer for 5-10 minutes. Serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

title: Caldo Verde Tradicional
ingredients: potatoes, kale, onion, garlic, chorizo, olive oil, cups of water, salt, black pepper
recipe: Peel and chop the potatoes, and slice the onion and garlic. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the water and potatoes, and cook until the potatoes are tender. Mash the potatoes and add the sliced kale. Cook until the kale is soft. Season with salt and black pepper. Slice the chorizo and serve it on top of the soup.

title: Caldo Verde com Linguiça
ingredients: potatoes, kale, onion, garlic, linguiças, olive oil, cups of water, salt, black pepper
recipe: Peel and chop the potatoes, and slice the onion and garlic. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the water and potatoes, and cook until the potatoes are tender. Mash the potatoes and add the sliced kale. Cook until the kale is soft. Season with salt and black pepper. Slice the linguiça and serve it on top of the soup.

title: Caldo Verde com Bacon
ingredients: potatoes, kale, onion, garlic, strips of bacon, olive oil, cups of water, salt, black peppe
recipe: Peel and chop the potatoes, and slice the onion and garlic. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the water and potatoes, and cook until the potatoes are tender. Mash the potatoes and add the sliced kale. Cook until the kale is soft. Season with salt and black pepper. Fry the bacon until crispy, and serve it on top of the soup.

title: Caldo Verde com Chouriço
ingredients: potatoes, kale, onion, garlic, chorizo, olive oil, cups of water, salt, black pepper
recipe: Peel and chop the potatoes, and slice the onion and garlic. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the water and potatoes, and cook until the potatoes are tender. Mash the potatoes and add the sliced kale. Cook until the kale is soft. Season with salt and black pepper. Slice the chouriço and serve it on top of the soup.

title: Jardineira de Frango
ingredients: chicken breast, potatoes, carrots, turnip, onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, chicken broth, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the chicken into small cubes, and peel and chop the vegetables. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the chicken and brown it. Add the vegetables and bay leaf, and cook for a few minutes. Add the chicken broth, season with salt and black pepper, and simmer for about 30 minutes, until the chicken and vegetables are tender.

title: Pastel de Nata
ingredients: puff pastry, milk, egg yolks, sugar,flour, cinnamon stick, lemon
recipe: Preheat the oven to 220°C. In a pot, mix the milk, sugar, flour, cinnamon stick and lemon peel. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat, let it cool and then add the egg yolks. Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into small circles. Place them in muffin tins, and then add the cream mixture. Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool before serving.

title: Vegetarian Pastel de Nata
ingredients: puff pastry, soy milk, egg yolks, brown sugar,cornstarch, cinnamon stick, lemon
recipe: Preheat the oven to 220°C. In a pot, mix the soy milk, brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon stick and lemon peel. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat, let it cool and then add the egg yolks. Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into small circles. Place them in muffin tins, and then add the cream mixture. Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool before serving.

title: Pastel de Nata com Creme de Avelã
ingredients: puff pastry, milk, egg yolks, sugar,flour, cinnamon stick, lemon , hazelnu
recipe: Preheat the oven to 220°C. In a pot, mix the milk, sugar, flour, cinnamon stick and lemon peel. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat, let it cool and then add the egg yolks. Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into small circles. Place them in muffin tins, and then add the cream mixture. Add a teaspoon of hazelnut spread on top of each one. Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool before serving.

title: Arroz de Cabidela com Pato
ingredients: duck, onions, of garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, tomato, carolino rice, liter of water, tablespoon of salt,red wine vinegar
recipe: In a pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf with olive oil. Peel and chop the tomato, and add it to the pot. Let it cook until the tomato is soft. Add the duck pieces and 1 tablespoon of salt. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 30 minutes on medium heat. Add enough water to cover the duck and let it cook until the meat is tender. Remove the duck pieces from the pot and set them aside. Add the rice to the pot and stir it. Let it cook for about 15 minutes. Return the duck to the pot, add the vinegar and stir. Let it cook for 5 more minutes. Serve hot.

title: Bacalhau com Natas
ingredients: salt cod, large potatoes, onions, garlic, heavy cream, olive oil, white wine, salt, black pepper, nutmeg
recipe: Soak the salt cod overnight in water, changing the water several times. Boil the cod in a pot of water until it flakes easily. Flake the cod into small pieces and set aside. Peel and slice the potatoes and boil them in salted water until they are tender. In a pan, sauté the sliced onions and garlic in olive oil until they become translucent. Add the flaked cod to the pan and cook for a few minutes. Add the white wine and let it cook for a minute. Add the heavy cream, season with salt, black pepper and nutmeg, and let it cook for 5 minutes. Add the boiled potatoes to the pan and stir everything together. Serve hot.

title: Bacalhau à Braz
ingredients: salt cod, large potatoes, onion, eggs, olive oil, garlic,chopped parsley,sliced olives, salt, black pepper
recipe: Soak the salt cod overnight in water, changing the water several times. Boil the cod in a pot of water until it flakes easily. Flake the cod into small pieces and set aside. Peel and julienne the potatoes and fry them in olive oil until golden brown. Remove the potatoes from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, sauté the sliced onions and garlic until they become translucent. Add the flaked cod and the fried potatoes, and cook for a few minutes. Beat the eggs and add them to the pan, stirring constantly until they are cooked. Add the parsley and olives, season with salt and black pepper, and serve hot.

title: Bacalhau à Braz com Pimentos
ingredients: salt cod, large potatoes, onion, eggs, olive oil, garlic,chopped parsley,sliced olives, bell peppers, salt, black pepper
recipe: Soak the salt cod overnight in water, changing the water several times. Boil the cod in a pot of water until it flakes easily. Flake the cod into small pieces and set aside. Peel and julienne the potatoes and fry them in olive oil until golden brown. Remove the potatoes from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, sauté the sliced onions and garlic until they become translucent. Add the flaked cod and the sliced bell peppers, and cook for a few minutes. Beat the eggs and add them to the pan, stirring constantly until they are cooked. Add the parsley and olives, season with salt and black pepper, and serve hot.

title: Jardineira com Vinho Tinto
ingredients: beef chuck, potatoes, carrots, turnip, onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, red wine, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the beef into small cubes, and peel and chop the vegetables. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the beef and brown it. Add the vegetables and bay leaf, and cook for a few minutes. Add the red wine, season with salt and black pepper, and simmer for about an hour, until the beef and vegetables are tender.

title: Baba de Camelo with vanilla
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla extract
notes: This recipe is perfect for people with a sweet tooth.
recipe: In a blender, mix the condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, cornstarch and vanilla extract until well combined. Pour the mixture into a pot and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Remove from heat and pour into a serving dish. Allow to cool, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

title: Baba de Camelo
ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, cocoa powder
notes: This recipe is perfect for those who love chocolate desserts.
recipe: Combine the condensed milk, eggs, milk, sugar, and cocoa powder in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a pot and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Pour the mixture into a serving dish and chill in the refrigerator for a few hours before serving.

title: Jardineira de Legumes
ingredients: potatoes, carrots, turnip, onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, vegetable broth, salt, black pepper
recipe: Peel and chop the vegetables. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the vegetables and bay leaf, and cook for a few minutes. Add the vegetable broth, season with salt and black pepper, and simmer for about 30 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.

title: Jardineira de Porco
ingredients: pork shoulder, potatoes, carrots, turnip, onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, pork broth, salt, black pepper
recipe: Cut the pork into small cubes, and peel and chop the vegetables. In a pot, sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until translucent. Add the pork and brown it. Add the vegetables and bay leaf, and cook for a few minutes. Add the pork broth, season with salt and black pepper, and simmer for about an hour, until the pork and vegetables are tender.

title: Arroz de Cabidela
ingredients: onion, garlic, olive oil, bay leaf, tomato, chicken, water, salt, carolino rice, vinegar, salad
recipe: In a pot, sauté the onion, garlic and bay leaf with olive oil. Peel and chop the tomatoes, and add them to the pot. Let it cook until the tomatoes are soft. Add the chicken pieces and 1 tbsp of salt. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 10 minutes on medium heat. Add enough water to cover the chicken and let it

title: Classic Canja
ingredients: water, salt, olive oil, garlic, chicken, pasta
recipe: Season chicken with cracked salt and pepper. Add water, salt, olive oil, and garlic to the water and bring to a boil on medium heat. Add chicken thighs and boil until cooked through, approximately 20 to 30 minutes. Remove chicken and remove skin and bones.  Shred chicken into small pieces.  Add pasta to water while shredding chicken and turn to low. Cook pasta until soft, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Add shredded chicken back to the pot and cook on low for a few more minutes. Remove garlic from soup and serve.

title: Traditional Bitoque
ingredients: beef steaks,garlic, olive oil, butter, salt, pepper,eggs, vegetable oil,French fries, rice
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper and set aside. Crush the garlic cloves and sauté them in a pan with the olive oil and butter. Add the beef steaks to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until browned. Transfer the beef steaks to an ovenproof dish and bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes, depending on how well done you like your steak. In another pan, fry the eggs in the vegetable oil until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Serve the beef steaks with a fried egg on top, along with French fries and white rice.

title: Bitoque with mushroom sauce
ingredients: beef steaks,olive oil, Salt, pepper, onion, garlic, mushrooms, butter, flour, beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, eggs, French fries, rice
recipe: Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper and set aside. In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and cook the steaks for 3-4 minutes on each side, until browned. Transfer the steaks to a plate and set aside. In the same pan, sauté the onion and garlic until soft. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, until browned and tender. Add the butter to the pan and let it melt. Then, add the flour and stir well. Slowly add the beef broth to the pan, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Add the Worcestershire sauce and let the sauce simmer for 5 minutes. Return the beef steaks to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes in the mushroom sauce. In another pan, fry the eggs until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Serve the beef steaks with a fried egg on top, along with French fries and white rice. Drizzle the mushroom sauce over the steaks and enjoy!

title: broad beans with spare ribs
ingredients: pork ribs, fava beans, onions, garlic, olive oil, bay leaves, sweet paprika, Salt, pepper,Water
recipe: In a large pot, heat the olive oil and sauté the onions and garlic until they become translucent. Add the pork ribs to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides. Add the bay leaves, sweet paprika, salt, and pepper, and stir well. Add enough water to cover the pork ribs, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the fava beans to the pot and stir well. If using fresh fava beans, remove the outer shell before adding to the pot. Add more water to cover the fava beans and pork ribs, and let it simmer for about 40-50 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the pork ribs are fully cooked. Adjust the seasoning if necessary and serve hot.

title: broad beans and Pork Rib Stew with Tomato
ingredients: pork ribs, fava beans, onions, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes, bay leaves, sweet paprika, Salt, pepper,Water
recipe: In a large pot, heat the olive oil and sauté the onions and garlic until they become translucent. Add the pork ribs to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides. Add the bay leaves, salt, and pepper, and stir well. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pot and stir well. Let it cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes have softened. Add the fava beans to the pot and stir well. If using fresh fava beans, remove the outer shell before adding to the pot. Add enough water to cover the fava beans and pork ribs, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 40-50 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the pork ribs are fully cooked. Adjust the seasoning if necessary and serve hot.

title: Feijoada à Transmontana
ingredients: white beans,smoked pork belly,salted pork,smoked sausage, onion,  garlic, bay leaves,Salt , pepper
recipe: In a large pot, cook the smoked pork belly and salted pork over medium heat until they're browned. Remove and set aside. In the same pot, sauté the onion and garlic until they're softened. Add the smoked sausage and brown for a few minutes. Add the soaked white beans to the pot and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beans are tender. Add the smoked pork belly, salted pork, and bay leaves to the pot, and stir. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the feijoada à transmontana with boiled potatoes, Portuguese-style collard greens, and a glass of red wine.

title: Feijoada à Alentejana
ingredients: red kidney beans, pork ribs, chorizo, onion, garlic, bay leaf, tomato ,Salt , pepper ,Olive oil
recipe: In a large pot, heat some olive oil and fry the chopped onion and minced garlic until translucent. Add the pork ribs and fry until browned. Add the sliced chorizo, soaked red kidney beans, bay leaf, tomato paste, salt, and pepper, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 2-3 hours, or until the beans and meat are tender. Adjust the seasoning, if necessary, and serve hot with boiled potatoes, and a glass of red wine.

title: Feijoada à Portuguesa
ingredients: white beans, beef,sausagem, onion, garlic,bay leaf, tomato ,Salt , pepper,Olive oil
recipe: In a large pot, heat some olive oil and fry the chopped onion and minced garlic until golden. Add the beef chuck and fry until browned. Add the sliced Portuguese sausage, soaked white beans, bay leaf, tomato paste, salt, and pepper, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 2-3 hours, or until the beans and meat are tender. Adjust the seasoning, if necessary, and serve hot with rice, and a glass of red wine.

title: Traditional Prego Sandwich
ingredients: Portuguese rolls,beef steaks,garlic,smoked paprika,olive oil,Salt , pepper ,Butter, tomatoes , lettuce
recipe: Season the beef steaks with garlic, smoked paprika, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the beef steaks for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Cut the Portuguese rolls in half and spread butter or mayonnaise on the bottom halves. Top each roll with a beef steak, sliced tomatoes, and lettuce. Cover with the top halves of the rolls and serve.

title: Prego Steak with Garlic Butter
ingredients: beef steaks,garlic,butter,olive oil,Salt , pepper,French fries , salad
recipe: Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add the olive oil. Cook the beef steaks for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Remove the steaks from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, reduce the heat to medium-low and add the butter and minced garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is fragrant and the butter is melted. Pour the garlic butter over the steaks and serve with French fries or a salad.

title: Prego Burger
ingredients: burger buns,beef,smoked paprika,garlic powder,Salt , pepper ,cheddar cheese,mayonnaise,ketchup, tomatoes , lettuce
recipe: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix the ingredients together until they are well combined. Form the beef mixture into 4 equal-sized patties. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the patties for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. In the meantime, mix together the mayonnaise and ketchup in a small bowl to make a sauce. Toast the burger buns in a toaster or under the broiler. Spread the sauce on the bottom halves of the burger buns. Top each bun with a beef patty, a slice of cheddar cheese, sliced tomatoes, and lettuce. Cover with the top halves of the buns and serve.

title: Prego Steak with Fried Egg
ingredients: beef steaks,garlic,olive oil,Salt , pepper , eggs,butter,French fries , salad
recipe: Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add the olive oil. Cook the beef steaks for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Remove the steaks from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, reduce the heat to medium-low and add the butter and minced garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is fragrant and the butter is melted. In a separate skillet, fry the eggs to your desired level of doneness. To serve, place a beef steak on each plate, top with a fried egg, and pour the garlic butter over the top. Serve with French fries or a salad.

title: Traditional Bifana Sandwich
ingredients: Portuguese rolls,pork cutlets, garlic, white wine,olive oil,Salt , pepper ,Sliced tomatoes , lettuce
recipe: Season the pork cutlets with garlic, salt, and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the pork cutlets for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until cooked through. Remove the pork cutlets from the skillet and set aside. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly. Pour in the white wine and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Slice the Portuguese rolls in half and place a pork cutlet on each bottom half. Top each pork cutlet with the garlic-wine sauce, sliced tomatoes, and lettuce. Cover with the top halves of the rolls and serve.

title: Bifana with Spicy Sauce
ingredients: pork cutlets,garlic,hot sauce, olive oil,Salt , pepper ,French fries , salad
recipe: Season the pork cutlets with garlic, salt, and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the pork cutlets for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until cooked through. Remove the pork cutlets from the skillet and set aside. In a small bowl, mix together the hot sauce and minced garlic. Spread the hot sauce mixture on top of each pork cutlet. Serve with French fries or a salad.

title: Bifana Stew
ingredients: pork tenderloin,garlic,onion,red bell pepper,olive oil,white wine,tomato sauce,paprika,ground cumin,Salt , pepper ,parsley
recipe: Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork tenderloin and cook for about 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned. Remove the pork tenderloin from the skillet and set aside. Add the minced garlic, chopped onion, and chopped red bell pepper to the skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft. Add the white wine, tomato sauce, paprika, cumin, and a pinch of salt and pepper to the skillet. Stir the ingredients together and bring to a simmer. Add the pork tenderloin back to the skillet and cook for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the pork is cooked through. Serve the bifana stew hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

title: Jardineira with Beef
ingredients: beeft, onion,garlic,carrots,potatoes,green beans,white beans,beef broth,bay leaf,Salt , pepper
recipe: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until softened. Add the carrots, potatoes, green beans, white beans, beef broth, and bay leaf to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender and the meat is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

title: Vegan Jardineira
ingredients: onion,garlic,carrots,potatoes,green beans,kidney beans,vegetable broth,bay leaf,Salt , pepper
recipe: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened. Add the carrots, potatoes, green beans, kidney beans, vegetable broth, and bay leaf to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

title: Jardineira with Pork
ingredients: pork,onion,garlic, carrots, potatoes,green beans,white beans,chicken broth,bay leaf,Salt , pepper
recipe: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook until browned on all sides. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until softened. Add the carrots, potatoes, green beans, white beans, chicken broth, and bay leaf to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender and the meat is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

title: Jardineira with Codfish
ingredients: codfish,onion,garlic,carrots,potatoes,green beans,white beans,fish stock,bay leaf,Salt , pepper
recipe: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened. Add the carrots, potatoes, green beans, white beans, fish stock, and bay leaf to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Add the codfish to the pot and let simmer for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

title: Chicken Jardineira
ingredients: chicken,onion,garlic ,carrots,potatoes,green beans,chickpeas,chicken broth,bay leaf,paprika,Salt , pepper
recipe: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until softened. Add the carrots, potatoes, green beans, chickpeas, chicken broth, bay leaf, and paprika to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

title: Cozido à Portuguesa
ingredients: 500g beef brisket, 500g pork ribs, 500g chicken legs or thighs, 1 chorizo sausage, 1 black pudding sausage, 1 cabbage, chopped, 4 carrots, peeled and sliced, 4 potatoes, peeled and chopped, 2 onions, peeled and chopped, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1 bay leaf, Salt and black pepper, Water
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef brisket, pork ribs, chicken legs or thighs, chorizo, black pudding, onions, garlic, bay leaf, and enough water to cover all the ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the carrots and potatoes to the pot and continue to simmer for another 30 minutes. Finally, add the chopped cabbage and let it cook for an additional 10-15 minutes until all the ingredients are tender. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve the Cozido à Portuguesa hot with a side of boiled rice or mashed potatoes.

title: Cozido à Portuguesa
ingredients: 1 beef brisket, cut into large pieces, 1 pork leg, cut into large pieces, 1 chicken, cut into large pieces, 1 chorizo sausage, sliced, 1 black pudding sausage, sliced, 1 cabbage, chopped, 4 carrots, peeled and sliced, 4 potatoes, peeled and chopped, 2 onions, peeled and chopped, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, Salt and black pepper, Water
recipe: In a large pot, add the beef brisket, pork leg, chicken, chorizo, black pudding, onions, garlic, bay leaves, and enough water to cover all the ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 1 hour. Add the carrots and potatoes to the pot and continue to simmer for another 30 minutes. Finally, add the chopped cabbage and let it cook for an additional 10-15 minutes until all the ingredients are tender. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve the Cozido à Portuguesa hot with a side of boiled rice or mashed potatoes.

title: Rabanadas
ingredients: 8 slices of day-old bread, 2 cups of milk, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup of sugar, 1 cinnamon stick, Lemon peel, Oil for frying
recipe: In a saucepan, heat the milk with the cinnamon stick and lemon peel until it reaches a boiling point. Remove from the heat and let it cool. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the sugar until it becomes a smooth mixture. Dip the bread slices in the milk mixture until they are soaked. Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Dip the soaked bread slices in the egg mixture until they are well coated. Fry the slices in the hot oil until they are golden brown. Drain the excess oil on a paper towel and sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on top. Serve the Rabanadas warm.

title: Rabanadas
ingredients: 8 slices of day-old bread,2 cups of red wine,1/2 cup of sugar,1 cinnamon stick,1 orange peel,Oil for frying
recipe: In a saucepan, heat the red wine with the cinnamon stick and orange peel until it reaches a boiling point. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and let it cool. In a bowl, mix the sugar with 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes until the sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens. Dip the bread slices in the red wine mixture until they are soaked. Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the slices in the hot oil until they are golden brown. Drain the excess oil on a paper towel and dip each slice in the sugar syrup. Serve the Rabanadas warm or cold.

title: Duck Rice
ingredients: 1 duck, cut into pieces, 2 cups of rice, 1 onion, chopped, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 cup of white wine, 4 cups of chicken broth, 1/2 cup of chopped parsley, Salt and black pepper, Olive oil
recipe: Season the duck pieces with salt and black pepper. In a large pot, heat some olive oil over medium heat and brown the duck pieces on all sides. Remove the duck from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onion, garlic, and bay leaves. Cook until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the white wine and let it simmer for a few minutes until it reduces by half. Add the rice to the pot and stir until it is coated with the onion and garlic mixture. Add the chicken broth to the pot and stir. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 10 minutes. Add the duck pieces to the pot and continue to cook until the rice is tender and the duck is cooked through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve the Arroz de Pato hot.

title: Duck Rice
ingredients: 2 duck legs, deboned and shredded, 2 cups of rice, 1 onion, chopped, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 cup of white wine, 4 cups of duck broth or chicken broth, 1/2 cup of chopped coriander, Salt and black pepper, Olive oil
recipe: In a large pot, heat some olive oil over medium heat and sauté the onion, garlic, and bay leaves until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the shredded duck to the pot and stir until it is coated with the onion and garlic mixture. Add the white wine and let it simmer for a few minutes until it reduces by half. Add the rice to the pot and stir until it is coated with the onion and garlic mixture. Add the duck or chicken broth to the pot and stir. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 10 minutes. Continue to cook until the rice is tender and the duck is cooked through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped coriander. Serve the Arroz de Pato hot.

title: Duck Rice
ingredients: 2 duck breasts, cut into small pieces, 2 cups of rice, 1 onion, chopped, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 cup of red wine, 4 cups of chicken broth, 1/2 cup of sliced olives, Salt and black pepper, Olive oil
recipe: In a large pot, heat some olive oil over medium heat and brown the duck pieces on all sides. Remove the duck from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onion, garlic, and bay leaves. Cook until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the red wine and let it simmer for a few minutes until it reduces by half. Add the rice to the pot and stir until it is coated with the onion and garlic mixture. Add the chicken broth to the pot and stir. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer

title: Rice Muffin
ingredients: 2 cups of rice flour, 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of butter, at room temperature, 4 eggs, 1/2 cup of milk, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, Zest of 1 lemon, Pinch of salt
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat until well combined. Add the milk, vanilla extract, and lemon zest to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. In a separate bowl, sift the rice flour, baking powder, and salt together. Gradually add the flour mixture to the mixing bowl, stirring until well combined. Grease a cake pan with butter and pour the batter into the pan. Bake the Bolo de Arroz for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool before serving.

title: Rice Muffin
ingredients: 2 cups of cooked rice, 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of butter, at room temperature, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, Zest of 1 lemon, Pinch of salt
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat until well combined. Add the milk, vanilla extract, and lemon zest to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. Add the cooked rice to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. In a separate bowl, sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Gradually add the flour mixture to the mixing bowl, stirring until well combined. Grease a cake pan with butter and pour the batter into the pan. Bake the Bolo de Arroz for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool before serving.

title: Sponge Cake
ingredients: 6 eggs, at room temperature,1 cup of sugar,1 cup of flour,1 teaspoon of vanilla extract,Pinch of salt
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a cake pan with butter and dust with flour. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla extract and salt to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. Gradually add the flour to the mixing bowl, stirring until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake the Pão de Ló for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool before serving.

title: Sponge Cake of Alfeizarão
ingredients: 8 eggs, at room temperature,1 cup of sugar,1 cup of flour,1/4 cup of cornstarch,1 tablespoon of grated lemon zest,1 tablespoon of grated orange zest,1/4 cup of butter, melted and cooled,1 teaspoon of baking powder,Pinch of salt
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a cake pan with butter and dust with flour. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the grated lemon zest, grated orange zest, and salt to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. Sift the flour, cornstarch, and baking powder together in a separate bowl. Gradually add the flour mixture to the mixing bowl, stirring until well combined. Add the melted butter to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake the Pão de Ló de Alfeizerão for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool before serving.

title: Sponge Cake of Ovar
ingredients: 12 eggs, at room temperature, 1 1/2 cups of sugar, 1 1/2 cups of flour, 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder, 1/4 cup of butter, melted and cooled, 1/4 cup of port wine, Pinch of salt
recipe: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a cake pan with butter and dust with flour. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy. Sift the flour and baking powder together in a separate bowl. Gradually add the flour mixture to the mixing bowl, stirring until well combined. Add the melted butter, port wine, and salt to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake the Pão de Ló de Ovar for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool before serving.

title: Lagareiro Octopus
ingredients: 1 large octopus (about 1 kg), 6 garlic cloves, thinly sliced, 1/2 cup olive oil, Salt, Fresh parsley, chopped
recipe: Clean the octopus, removing the beak and the eyes, and rinse well. In a large pot, bring water to a boil, add the octopus, and cook for about 40-50 minutes, or until tender. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Drain the octopus and let it cool. Cut the octopus into small pieces and place them in a baking dish. Add the sliced garlic and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and bake in the oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

title: Lagareiro Octopus
ingredients: 1 large octopus (about 1 kg), 1/2 cup olive oil, 8 garlic cloves, thinly sliced, 2 bay leaves, Salt and pepper, 4 large potatoes, sliced, Fresh parsley, chopped
recipe: Clean the octopus, removing the beak and the eyes, and rinse well. In a large pot, bring water to a boil, add the octopus, bay leaves, and salt, and cook for about 40-50 minutes, or until tender. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Drain the octopus and cut it into small pieces. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the sliced garlic. Cook until the garlic is fragrant, then add the sliced potatoes and cook until golden brown. Add the octopus to the skillet, season with salt and pepper, and stir well. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

title: Açorda
ingredients: 6 slices of rustic bread, stale, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 1/2 cup olive oil, 4 cups water, 4 eggs, Salt and pepper, Fresh cilantro, chopped
recipe: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil and add the bread slices. Cook the bread for about 10 minutes, or until it starts to break down. In a separate pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the minced garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add the bread and cooking water to the pan with the garlic and olive oil, and stir well. Crack the eggs over the top of the mixture and stir gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer until the eggs are cooked to your liking. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

title: Açorda with shrimp
ingredients: 6 slices of rustic bread, stale, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 1/2 cup olive oil, 4 cups water, 1 lb. shrimp, peeled and deveined, 1/2 cup white wine, 1/2 cup chopped parsley, Salt and pepper
recipe: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil and add the bread slices. Cook the bread for about 10 minutes, or until it starts to break down. In a separate pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the minced garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add the bread and cooking water to the pan with the garlic and olive oil, and stir well. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the white wine to the pan and continue cooking until the shrimp are fully cooked. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

title: Rock Soup Alentejana
ingredients: 1 lb. beans, soaked overnight, 1 lb. potatoes, peeled and cubed, 1 lb. beef, cubed, 1 lb. Portuguese chouriço, sliced, 1 onion, diced, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, Salt and pepper, Olive oil, 1 Portuguese chouriço, sliced, for garnish
recipe: In a large pot, add the soaked beans, beef, chouriço, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the beans and meat are cooked through. Remove the bay leaves and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Add the cubed potatoes to the pot and cook until they are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with sliced chouriço and a drizzle of olive oil.

title: Rock Soup
ingredients: 1 lb. beans, soaked overnight, 1 lb. Portuguese chouriço, sliced, 1 onion, diced, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 2 bay leaves, Salt and pepper, Olive oil, 1 Portuguese chouriço, sliced, for garnish, 1 bunch of fresh coriander, chopped, for garnish
recipe: In a large pot, add the soaked beans, chouriço, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the beans are cooked through. Remove the bay leaves and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. In a separate pan, sauté the sliced chouriço until crispy. Serve hot, garnished with the crispy chouriço, chopped coriander, and a drizzle of olive oil.

title: Traditional Roasted Suckling Pig
ingredients: 1 suckling pig, about 8 to 10 pounds, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 lemon, sliced, 1 bunch of fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, oregano), 1 cup white wine, 1 cup water
recipe: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix the salt, paprika, and olive oil together in a small bowl to make a paste. Rub the paste all over the pig, including the cavity and the skin. Stuff the pig with the lemon slices and fresh herbs. Place the pig on a roasting pan and add the white wine and water to the pan. Roast the pig in the preheated oven for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the skin is crispy and golden brown and the internal temperature of the pig reaches 145°F. Remove the pig from the oven and let it rest for about 20 minutes before carving.

title: Grilled Suckling Pig
ingredients: 1 suckling pig, about 8 to 10 pounds, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 lemon, sliced, 1 bunch of fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, oregano), Charcoal for grilling
recipe: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Mix the salt, paprika, and olive oil together in a small bowl to make a paste. Rub the paste all over the pig, including the cavity and the skin. Stuff the pig with the lemon slices and fresh herbs. Place the pig on the grill, close the lid, and cook for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours, turning occasionally, until the skin is crispy and golden brown and the internal temperature of the pig reaches 145°F. Remove the pig from the grill and let it rest for about 20 minutes before carving.
